questions.question: What is the purpose of using a reflector in an autocollimator?

answers.a: Increase the intensity of the reflected light beam
answers.b: Direct reflect light beam along its original path
answers.c: Disperse the light to spectral components
answers.d: To polarise the incident light beam

questions.question: What is the function of beam splitter in autocollimator?

answers.a: Increase the intensity of light beam
answers.b: To split the return light into two separate paths
answers.c: Magnify the image through observed through the eyepiece
answers.d: Direct the light beam towards target graticule

questions.question: What is the function of optical micrometer in autocollimator?

answers.a: Adjust the focal length of the collimating lens
answers.b: Measure the intensity of the reflected beam
answers.c: Measure the angular deviations of the reflected beam

questions.question: Why target graticule is kept  perpendicular to the optical axis in autocollimator?

answers.a: Improve the resolution of angular measurements
answers.b: To ensure accurate alignment of the reflected beam
answers.c: For enhancing the visibility of the reflected beam
answers.d: To minimize the errors in measurement
